1.text: Jack's bath time takes a wild turn as the things in his bathtub start to change, and a group of animals becomes part of his adventurous bathtub safari! English 97809992235765 Sarah-Jane Williams, Robert McEwan & Tracy Lynn Chemaly
1.summary: Jack's bathtub transforms into an adventurous safari with changing animals.

3.text: Bathtime is Jack’s favourite part of the day. ‘I’ll be back in a few moments,’ says his mom. ‘Make sure to clean behind your ears.’
3.summary: Jack enjoys bathtime while his mom reminds him to clean well.

4.text: There's a SWOOSH. And a swish of a tail. And then...
4.summary: A boy swims and encounters a crocodile in the water.

5.summary: Jack rides a crocodile in his bathtub safari adventure.

6.text: Look at what’s coming! There’s a twist and a turn... Something’s growing... It’s a...
6.summary: A boy notices something growing in the water.

7.summary: A boy rides an elephant and they spray water.

8.text: There’s a RUMBLE! UP UP It’s going up and... UP
8.summary: A boy warns of a rumble and chaos ensues.

9.summary: Boys have fun splashing with a giraffe in the water.

10.text: There’s a SPLOSH. Something bubbles. It’s time to...
10.summary: A boy splashes in water with a hippo.

11.text: AAAAAAH But something's lurking in the background...
11.summary: A boy rides a hippo while something lurks nearby.

12.summary: A lion roars loudly while playing with purple balls.

13.text: ‘Time to get out. I hope you’re clean and ready for bed.’
13.summary: Mom tells child to get out of bath and get ready for bed.

14.summary: A child sleeps with animal toys in a cozy bed.

16.summary: No text on this blank page

17.text: Did you enjoy the story? Would you like to play a game?
17.summary: Questions about story enjoyment and game interest.

18.summary: Retell the story of the boy's adventures.

19.text: Which animal is your favourite and why?
19.summary: Asks which animal is favorite and why.

20.text: Did you enjoy reading together today?
20.summary: Ask if the child enjoyed reading together today.

21.text: This is a credits/copyright page containing Book Dash organization information, Creative Commons license details, and author/illustrator credits for 'Bathtub Safari' by Sarah-Jane Williams, Robert McEwan & Tracy Lynn Chemaly
21.summary: Copyright and credits page with publishing information and Creative Commons licensing details.
